text:
October 8, 1959
Mr. Ken Kager
Radio Station KUOW
The University of Washington
Seattle 5, Washington
Dear Ken:
Lee Dreyfuss of Wayne State just called me this morning to
see whether I would take over the responsibility for a section
on radio research at the upcoming NAEB meeting. This is rather
short notice and, unfortunately, it seems to me to be one which
is sorely in need of some attention — so, like a mad man, 1
accepted. The point of this letter, of course, is that X hope
you are coming to Detroit for the meeting and that you will
be willing to expound for 15 or 20 minutes on your personal
influence study — the sort of thing which you included in
the abstract which you sent around plus. Ideally, your ideas
for where we ought to go from here with future research efforts
in this general area. The meeting will be from 9:00 to 10 a.m.,
Thursday, October 29. X am trying to get Jack Ellery of Wayne
to do something on their FM study and then, perhaps, someone
who has done some decent research on in-school radio.
I hope that I can hear from you soon in the affirmative.
Best regards,
Samuel L. Becker
Director, Division of
